page.title: 14BRADFORD HOUSE, BELBROUGHTON
page.content: An estate at{Bradford}first mentioned in{13C.}Owned by{John de {Bradford.}Nothing further known until {1650}when{William Penn}owned it. In{1795 Elizabeth Mariane Harris inherited the house. It was sold in {1818;}she had built the dovecote and a barn. {Charles Perrot Noel}died in{1908}and left the house to his wife who died in {1916}and it passed to the{Lyttleton family.{Thomas Wood,}a{tenant farmer, bought the house in{1918. In{1935, Raleigh Robert Adam}bought it for{Â£5,250}with{75 acres;}it was very run down. The arable land was sold off in{1951}before{Thomas {Hollingsworth}bought it. In{1985}the{Kendrick}family own the house, which has{30 acres}of land,{25 of which are grazed.
